Dear Mrs. Idziak:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (616)552-3662.

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?

game of truth or dare. There was no supervision when the incident
happened.

ALLEGATION:
Resident was dared to touch another resident's vagina during a game of truth or
dare. There was no supervision when the incident happened.
INVESTIGATION:
On 6/18/2020 I received a call from Administrator 1 to report that Residents C & D
reported to Staff 2 that, during a game of Truth or Dare on 6/17/2020, Resident B
touched Resident A’s vagina. The staff reported that this took place between eye on
checks. Administrator 1 reported that Residents A & B have not been put on
precautions and have safety plans in place.
2

Interviews
On 6/22/2020 I made an unannounced visit to the facility and interviewed Staff 1, 2 3
and 4, Residents A, B, C, and D, and Therapist 1. All 4 residents reported that they
were standing in the hallway playing Truth or Dare on 6/17/2020. All the residents
reported that Resident C and Resident D kissed and that Resident B kissed
Resident A. Resident A also reported that Resident B touched her vagina, inside her
pants. The residents reported that the staff were not around at the time, but were
completing checks on them, so they would play the game in between checks. The
residents reported that they went outside to have a snack and continue the game at
which time Resident B touched Resident A’s butt and Residents C and D kissed
again.
Staff 3 and 4 reported that on 6/17/2020 the 4 residents were in the hallway outside
of Resident A’s room. Staff 3 stated that he was moving between the dining room,
hallway, and staff office showing Staff 5 how to do various duties. Staff 3 reported
that typically two staff wouldn’t be in the office at the same time, but the laptop
wasn’t working and Staff 3 had to show Staff 5 how to enter information into the
computer system. Staff 4 stated he was in the tv room with another resident and
wasn’t responsible for supervision of the other residents, but he stated that Staff 3
and 5 should have remained in earshot of the residents in the hallway. Staff 3
reported that the residents were never alone in the hallway for more than 2 minutes
at a time. He stated that, when they moved outside, Staff 5 was watching them from
the dining room.
Therapist 1 reported that she was not at the facility when the incident was reported,
but she called and spoke to the staff and residents involved. She reported that
Resident A does demonstrate some hypersexualized behavior, but she has never
engaged in any sexual perpetration. Therapist 1 stated that Resident A is on
increased supervision status, no residents can congregate in doorways, and the
residents cannot be outside alone together.
Staff 1 and 2 both reported that they were made aware of the incident the following
day and that increased supervision of the residents has been implemented since.
On 7/7/2020 I interviewed Staff 5 and Staff 6 at the facility. Staff 6 reported that she
was Resident E’s 1:1 staff on 6/17/2020 so she was not responsible for supervising
the other residents, but she does recall seeing them in the hallway together. Staff 5
stated that she was completing a training shift on 6/17/2020. She reported that she
and Staff 3 were alternating doing checks. She stated that, she would go into the
staff office with Staff 3 to enter data into the computer for no more than 2 minutes at
a time. Otherwise, she was in the dining room keeping an eye on the residents in the
hallway. She stated that the youth should always have been in line of sight and that
it was unusual that they were left alone. She reported that when the residents went
outside she watched them from the dining room window and would conduct checks
“here and there,”
3

Documents
On 7/7/2020 I reviewed the facility’s supervision policy which states that staff are to
complete eye on checks of residents at varying intervals no less that 15 minutes. I
also reviewed an Incident completed 6/18/2020 reporting that documented the
residents’ reports of the incident and the resident observation log documenting that
Staff 3 and 5 were completing the checks on the residents at the time of the incident.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care, and
other staff on duty to perform the prescribed functions
required by these administrative rules and in the agency's
program statement and to provide for the continual needs,
protection, and supervision of residents.
ANALYSIS: Residents were able to engage in sexual contact with one
another while they were congregated near a resident’s doorway
and while outside during which time staff were not providing
continual supervision of the residents.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
This is a repeat violation cited in:
SIR 2019C0112035 dated 8/2/2019, CAP approved 8/29/2019
SIR 2019C0112033 dated 8/6/2019, CAP approved 8/29/2019
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend no change in the license status upon receipt of an acceptable CAP.
